message.content:
cs.LG, cs.CV, cs.AI, cs.CL, cs.NE 

The paper proposes a novel local metric learning method for distance-based classification, which is a common problem in machine learning and computer vision. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.LG (Machine Learning), followed by cs.CV (Computer Vision) and cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence). The paper also mentions the use of regularization and hinge loss, which are common techniques in natural language processing (NLP) and computational linguistics (CL), making cs.CL a possible sub-category. Finally, the paper's focus on learning local metrics and influential regions could also be relevant to neural networks and optimization, making cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing) a possible sub-category.
